title: Lightnin' Hopkins - 1961 - Blues Hoot (vinyl 24 96 1995) FLAC
description:
Lightnin' Hopkins - 1961 - Blues Hoot (1995)
Vinyl, 24 bits, 96 Khz

Blues Hoot is a live recording from 1961, taped at the Ash Grove in Hollywood, California, featuring short acoustic sets from Lightnin' Hopkins and the folk- blues duo Sonny Terry and Brownie McGhee, as well as a middle set where all three play together, joined by Big Joe Williams. Highlights include "Big Car Blues" by Hopkins, and a spirited version of"Down by the Riverside" by Terry and McGhee, as well as two bonus tracks by the duo "("I'm a Stranger Here,"" "Trouble In Mind") recorded at the Troubadour. There's nothing groundbreaking here, but it's a pleasant show with all participants in peak form. (AllMusic)

Track list:
Side one:
LIGHTNIN' HOPKINS
1. Introduction to Big Car Blues
2. Big Car Blues
3. Coffee House Blues
4. Stool Pigeon Blues
5. Ball of Twine
(Sam Lightnin' Hopkins)
LIGHTNIN' HOPKINS WITH SONNY TERRY, BROWNIE McGHEE and BIG JOE WILLIAMS
6. Blues For Gamblers
7. Right On That Shore
Side two:
*1. Early Morning Blues
(Traditional)
SONNY TERRY & BROWNIE McGHEE
2. Walk On (Brownie McGhee-Ruth McGhee)
3. Blues For The Lowlands (McGhee-Terry)
4. Down By The Riverside (Traditional)
*5. Po' Boy (McGhee-Terry)
**6. I'm A Stranger Here (Traditional, arr.: Terry-McGhee)
**7. Trouble In Mind (Traditional, arr.: Terry-McGhee)
*Bonus tracks from the original Ash Grove sessions not included on the original LP release
**Recorded live at the Troubadour

Personnel:
Sonny Terry
Lightnin' Hopkins
Brownie Mcghee
Big Joe Williams

Enjoy and share!
